detailed_info.name: Isopropyl alcohol
detailed_info.description:
Isopropyl alcohol is one of the most widely used alcohols in cosmetics. Discovered in the 1920s, it is synthesized from a reaction between propylene and sulfuric acid, followed by hydrolysis. It is used as an antiseptic in cosmetic products: it is found for example in aftershave lotions, hand lotions.
Note that the oxidation of isopropyl alcohol produces acetone.

functions.name: Antifoaming
functions.description: Removes foam during manufacturing / reduces foam formation in liquid finished products

functions.name: Viscosity controlling
functions.description: Increases or decreases the viscosity of cosmetics

functions.name: Perfuming
functions.description: Used for perfume and aromatic raw materials

functions.name: Emulsion stabilising
functions.description: Promotes the emulsification process and improves the stability and shelf life of the emulsion

functions.name: Hair conditioning
functions.description: Leaves hair easy to comb, soft, soft and shiny and / or confers volume, lightness and shine

functions.name: Skin protecting
functions.description: Helps to avoid the harmful effects of external factors on the skin
